context: The word 'aegade' is the plural genitive form of the Estonian noun 'aeg', meaning 'time'. In this plural genitive case, it means 'of times', 'of periods', or 'of ages'. It refers to different time periods or eras that something belongs to or affects. For example, 'aegade väärtused' would mean 'the values of the times/periods', and 'kererulised aegade' would mean 'difficult times/eras'.
